sourcesContent:
import React, { useState, useEffect } from 'react'; import './App.css'; const App = () => { const [activeStage, setActiveStage] = useState(null); const [isProcessing, setIsProcessing] = useState(false); const [processStep, setProcessStep] = useState(0); const [materials, setMaterials] = useState({ castorOil: { amount: 10, unit: 'ml', color: '#FFD700' }, distilledWater: { amount: 40, unit: 'ml', color: '#87CEEB' }, naoh: { amount: 5, unit: 'gm', color: '#FF6B6B' }, glycerol: { amount: 10, unit: 'ml', color: '#98FB98' }, nacl: { amount: 5, unit: 'gm', color: '#F0F8FF' }, nahco3: { amount: 5, unit: 'gm', color: '#DDA0DD' } }); const startProcess = () => { setIsProcessing(true); setProcessStep(1); }; useEffect(() => { if (isProcessing && processStep < 5) { const timer = setTimeout(() => { setProcessStep(prev => prev + 1); }, 2000); return () => clearTimeout(timer); } else if (processStep >= 5) { setIsProcessing(false); } }, [isProcessing, processStep]); const stages = [ { id: 1, name: 'Raw Material Storage', x: 80, y: 120 }, { id: 2, name: 'Mixing Reactor', x: 250, y: 180 }, { id: 3, name: 'Saponification Reactor', x: 460, y: 180 }, { id: 4, name: 'Filtration System', x: 650, y: 180 }, { id: 5, name: 'Final Product Storage', x: 860, y: 120 } ]; return (

Liquid Soap Factory - Chemical Prototyping

Interactive Virtual Model for Saponification Process

Raw Materials

{Object.entries(materials).map(([key, material]) => (
{key.replace(/([A-Z])/g, ' $1').replace(/^./, str => str.toUpperCase())}
{material.amount} {material.unit}
))}
{/* Control Panel */}

Process Control

Current Status:

{isProcessing ? `Step ${processStep}/5 - Processing` : 'Ready to Start'}

Material Composition:

Castor Oil {materials.castorOil.amount}{materials.castorOil.unit}
Distilled Water {materials.distilledWater.amount}{materials.distilledWater.unit}
Sodium Hydroxide (NaOH) {materials.naoh.amount}{materials.naoh.unit}
Glycerol {materials.glycerol.amount}{materials.glycerol.unit}
Sodium Chloride (NaCl) {materials.nacl.amount}{materials.nacl.unit}
Sodium Bicarbonate (NaHCO₃) {materials.nahco3.amount}{materials.nahco3.unit}
{activeStage && (

Stage {activeStage}: {stages[activeStage - 1].name}

{activeStage === 1 && (

Function: Storage of all raw materials in controlled environment

Materials Stored:

  • Castor Oil (10ml) - Primary fat source
  • Distilled Water (40ml) - Solvent
  • NaOH (5gm) - Strong alkali for saponification
  • Glycerol (10ml) - Moisturizing agent
  • NaCl (5gm) - Thickening agent
  • NaHCO₃ (5gm) - pH buffer

Conditions: Temperature: 25°C | Pressure: 1 atm | Humidity: <60%

)} {activeStage === 2 && (

Function: Homogeneous mixing of oils with alkali solution

Process: Castor oil is slowly added to NaOH solution while maintaining constant agitation

Equipment: High-speed mechanical stirrer with temperature control

Conditions: Temperature: 60-80°C | Mixing Speed: 200 RPM | Duration: 30 min

Critical Parameters: Maintain temperature to prevent oil degradation

)} {activeStage === 3 && (

Function: Saponification reaction - conversion of fats to soap

Chemical Reaction: C₃H₅(OCOR)₃ + 3NaOH → 3RCOONa + C₃H₅(OH)₃

Process: Heated reaction vessel with continuous stirring for complete conversion

Conditions: Temperature: 80-100°C | Reaction Time: 2-4 hours | pH: 12-13

Monitoring: Temperature, pH, and saponification value checked hourly

)} {activeStage === 4 && (

Function: Removal of impurities, unreacted materials, and excess alkali

Process: Multi-stage filtration with activated carbon and membrane filters

Equipment: Pressure filtration system with 0.1μm membrane

Conditions: Pressure: 2-3 bar | Flow Rate: 50 L/hr | Temperature: 40°C

Quality Check: Clarity, color, and particle count analysis

)} {activeStage === 5 && (

Function: Final product storage with quality assurance testing

Quality Parameters:

  • pH: 9-10 (skin-friendly range)
  • Viscosity: 1000-3000 cP
  • Total Fatty Matter: >15%
  • Free Alkali: <0.1%
  • Moisture Content: <70%

Storage: Stainless steel tanks with nitrogen blanketing

Shelf Life: 24 months under proper storage conditions

)}
)}

Objective

Prepare liquid soap through saponification where fats/oils react with potassium hydroxide (KOH) to form soap and glycerin. Understanding chemical reactions, ingredient roles, and proper formulation for high-quality, stable, skin-friendly liquid soap.

Chemical Reaction

Fat/Oil + KOH → Soap + Glycerin

C₃H₅(OCOR)₃ + 3KOH → 3RCOOK + C₃H₅(OH)₃

); }; export default App;
